text: Larry is distracted by the music from the softy truck and the other team steals a run.
At dinner, Cathy Griffin walks up to the table, and it is revealed in conversation that Cathy never spoke to Jeff.
Larry confronts Susie why she didn't tell him about Bridget's kid having Asperger's syndrome.
She liked him better when he was working on Seinfeld the whole time.
The only good thing about the evening is the amazing chocolate log cake they serve for dessert.
All the investments are gone, and Jeff has to sell his house.
Larry has his secretary research the origins of the Cobb Salad, who tells her it was invented in Hollywood.
The psychic also predicted the pregnancy of one of Cheryl's friends by name.
Ted is offended & asks Larry to exchange the shirt.
He doesn't have to pee all the time.
He tells Cheryl that maybe the coughing fit is what offended Ted & Mary.The next day Larry goes to the store to return the jacket he bought.

Larry has to put the book aside when their driver Charlie (Toby Huss) arrives to take them to the party.When they arrive at the party, Larry is concerned that Charlie will be bored waiting, but Charlie insists he'll be fine: it's his job to wait.
Because of the extra weight of the beans, he cannot fly home himself, and is forced to watch everyone else leave on the plane.
Jeff asks Larry to make things up with Victor, as he is obsessed with not being thanked for his service by Larry.

He learns that the washing machine at the safe house is broken and offers them use of the machine in his house, till they can get theirs fixed.Stella meets Larry and Richard for dinner and tells them that she has decided to get her breasts reduced by roughly half.
Larry returns to the restaurant where Heidi is the hostess, and she puts a strong laxative in his food.
Julia explains that she took her 2nd daughter to a birthday party.
Larry wants to dial his friend John but picks the wrong number from the address book and ends up getting a dinner invite for a party at Gil's house.
Ron's wife is a real difficult person and constantly hassles him over little things.
Larry says that he didn't know what a baptism looked like.
Dr. Bright says this isn't his top priority at the moment.
Larry says that they will have to keep looking till they find a chef that they can all agree on.

Larry advises against that.Larry makes the call to Julia to agrees to go to his neighbor's house, but when they visit (after making an appointment with Dean), the wife's (Phyllis) cat has died & she is inconsolable.
Larry suspects that Susie complained to Ted Danson and Marty about Oscar pleasuring him.
Cheryl can use the script on stage and the show opens in a week.
So, Larry promises Jones to do a big brother kind of thing to help Jones's community.
Jeff tells Larry that Diane won't do a show with anyone who doesn't respect her time.Cheryl hires an interior decorator (Rose Abdoo) who also happens to be Diane Keaton's.
Richard pays the bill the next day.
She tells Michael that her husband has been dead for 2 years.
Jeff loves the sponge cake, but Susie hates sponge cake.
John feels that Larry is being insulting to the illness Groat syndrome and the cause.
Cheryl doesn't know, but says he owns his own underwear company.Cheryl goes to stay with her sister Becky (Kaitlin Olson).
On stage, Larry and David put aside their differences and blow the audience away.Unexpectedly, Mel Brooks isn't impressed.
Jeff knew that the caterer stole Larry's leftovers.Jeff & Larry visit Mike's workshop who says he will fix the car, as there is only some minor damage to it.
Richard just wants her to take a Benadryl.
Later, Susie figures out that Oscar is all lethargic.
Jeff and Susie are going away to NYC for 3 months to help Sammi settle into university.
Jason sticks to his contention that the plan was to have a meeting, and the meeting never took place.
He decides to get dinner, but only the drive through is open.
Larry says that Rosie came on his invitation and hence he should pay the bill, while Rosie says she had the bill in her hand, so she pays.
Larry sits at Cheryl's side, and not opposite to her.
But before the show starts, Jean stomps up and causes a scene, angrily signing to Susie that Larry made racist comments to Hal on the phone.
Larry misses his flight by a few seconds as the attendant won't keep the door to the flight open as he was running towards it.
Cheryl has stated in her vows that she wishes to be with Larry for eternity, but Larry wants to stick to "till death do us apart" and not carry on in the afterlife.
Larry is talking to his dad loudly when Ruth walks in and Larry is screaming the words "die, die, die" in a conversation with his dad.
He is not happy that she is revealing his private information to anyone who calls his house.
Larry (Larry David) is changed by a near-death experience.
Larry asks Richard if Lisa has his phone.
The colored man tries to attack Larry.

Clive and Carol meet, and begin a relationship, which is short-lived when Clive discovers her profession, and they get into a fight in the street, which leads to her presumed death after being hit by a van.Larry attempts to deflate the doll after discovering Leon has been using it but is caught in a compromising position with it by his housekeeper, and Cheryl.
Larry, Jeff, Susie, and Leon return from Atlanta.
Leon and Larry go into business providing short term relief for workers who need to use the bathroom during their shifts.

Larry decides to use his time spent in the bathroom learning the Gettysburg Address but in the process conditions himself to have to urinate any time he hears it causing complications when he goes to see Ted Danson and Lori Loughlin in a play about Abraham Lincoln.
At a Chinese restaurant, Larry and HBO executive Allan Wasserman's accidentally take each other's takeout orders.
Susie asks Larry and Jeff to pick up Pinkberry frozen yogurt for Oscar as his last meal.
He is fired after arguing with Richard at the dealership as he is trying to sell a car to someone.
Larry shows Jeff his finished script for a musical comedy he has been writing, Fatwa!, based on Salman Rushdie's life.

He is irritated because he does not even know the man well and soon finds himself caught on a text chain with the man's family and also inundated with requests to keep an eye on his daughter if anything happens to him.
Larry finds the watch on hotel repairman Sanjay's wrist and takes it from him, then gives it to David.
Larry is given a ticket after he honks at the police car stopped in front of him at a green light.
Oscar goes missing and he suspects his Korean bookmaker of killing him and serving him to attendees of the wedding of a couple who are Cheryl's friends.
Larry and Jerry have problems with their assistant (Jillian Bell), who always wears clothes that expose her large abdomen.
Things go from bad to worse when Larry stops by the cemetery asking that his burial plot be moved far away from Ted Danson.
Larry returns to the dry cleaners and discovers they have lost the robe (presumably on purpose).
Larry, Leon, Jeff, Susie, and Cheryl all head over to Cabo San Lucas for a friend's wedding on a private jet.
Larry is invited to Deidre and her husband's 10th anniversary party and during the ceremony, the cameraman (whom Larry previously offended) films the vows and catches Larry acting extremely bored.
Larry offends Dylan by stuffing tissue paper in his ears because he dislikes the music.
Larry sees recently transitioned Joey Funkhouser nude in his country clubs locker room and questions whether he will be able to manage his large penis.
Freddy also wants to get out of his own relationship as his girlfriend works at the Disney Store, not as an executive at Disney as he believed.
In Atlanta, the maid at the hotel is upset by the state of Larry's room but he promises to leave her a generous tip.
He plans on pleading guilty and avoiding a trial, but Auntie Rae wants him to fight the law.
When he visits the hospital to have his injury treated, accompanied by Leon, the doctor treating Larry wrongly assumes that the injury was caused by Leon.
This leads to an argument between Colby and Solly over who has endured the most.
Larry watches a TV news report in which it is stated that Richard's cousin Louis has been shot during a robbery and is in a coma, not expected to survive.
Larry also walks into a screen glass door.
Larry lends $5,000 to an old friend, Barry Weiner, who says he will repay it when his father dies, as he feels he is owed an inheritance.
They plan to attend a Kim Chee Yun recital being held by Larry's friends.
Wanda tells Larry and Cheryl that according to a well-connected acquaintance of hers there will be a terrorist attack in L.A.

Larry inadvertently gets a restaurant investor's nanny (Cheri Oteri)who used to work at Six Flags Magic Mountain Looney Tunes Lodgefired when he convinces her to let him use the investor's private bathroom.
Jeff has sex with Marty Funkhouser's mentally unstable sister, Bam Bam (Catherine O'Hara).
Back at the chiropractor's office, Larry discovers that Jason has converted him.
He is even more suspicious when Cynthia cannot fully detail her suicide attempt, upsetting Richard for interfering in his life.

To fix the problem with the mechanic, Larry claims to be on the "spectrum" to explain his previous rude behavior, resulting in the mechanic changing attitude completely, offering to fix his car immediately, free of charge.
Irma tells Larry it is either her or Leon who stays in the house.
When Rick tells him that he loves Seinfeld and golf and is Jewish, he warms to Rick.
The reception on Larry's first call on his new cell phone cuts out, leading to Cheryl not hearing from him that Richard's new Christian Scientist girlfriend, Deborah, has a nut allergy.
Larry hires street prostitute Monena (Kym Whitley) to be a passenger in his car so that he can legally use the car pool lane in order to get to Dodger Stadium on time.
Slavin passes his story on to Cheryl.
Larry goes on a date with Sienna Miller.
Larry's elation at this causes him to be shunned by lesbians.
Larry accidentally touches a server's breast when trying to grab food from the tray.
Larry offends the headmistress of the school when he stands behind her in an ice cream line and criticizes her for sampling every single flavor.
Thinking they are talking about who donated the museum wing, Cheryl tells Susie that Ted Danson did it.
When he discovers it was Cheryl, he asks her to phone Julia to tell her, which she refuses to do.
Larry meets a police officer with the surname Krupke and is surprised with him being unaware that he shares his name with a West Side Story character.
Larry is puzzled when Yoshi says that his father was a kamikaze pilot in World War II, to which the dealer says that he grazed the target ship.
When an ambulance takes the injured man with Larry's sweater on, he goes to the hospital to try to retrieve it, annoying one of the receptionists in the process.
Larry then drops his own glasses into the toilet at the hotel and argues with the maid about who should retrieve them.
In the street, Larry walks past a restaurant manager, who is annoyed at Larry not stopping to chat.
They manage to convince the waitress to let them order breakfast anyway and Larry has also brought his own organic eggs.
